title: How to Make Peppermint Penguins

steps.headline: Wash your hands.
steps.description: Never start cooking unless your hands are clean.

steps.headline: In a bowl, use a fork to mix 1 tablespoon softened butter (NOT margarine), 1 tablespoon light corn syrup, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon mint extract.
Gradually add 1 cup powdered sugar one spoonful at a time.
Knead dough with your hands and continue adding powdered sugar.
Knead 1 drop of blue food coloring into 1/4 of the dough.
Knead 1 drop purple food coloring into 1/2 of the dough.
Pinch a marble size piece of dough and knead 1 drop of red and one drop of yellow food coloring into it.
Place one marble size ball of dough on wax paper to make the body.
Stack one blue marble size ball on top for the head.
Form 2 wings out of blue dough and attach them to the sides of the body.
Press on candy sprinkles for eyes.
Form a beak, a scarf, and a hat or earmuffs out of colored dough.

text: Wash your hands. Never start cooking unless your hands are clean. In a bowl, use a fork to mix 1 tablespoon softened butter (NOT margarine), 1 tablespoon light corn syrup, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon mint extract.  Gradually add 1 cup powdered sugar one spoonful at a time.  Knead dough with your hands and continue adding powdered sugar.  Knead 1 drop of blue food coloring into 1/4 of the dough.  Wash hands.  Knead 1 drop purple food coloring into 1/2 of the dough.  Wash hands.  Pinch a marble size piece of dough and knead 1 drop of red and one drop of yellow food coloring into it.  Wash hands.  Place one marble size ball of dough on wax paper to make the body.  Stack one blue marble size ball on top for the head.  Form 2 wings out of blue dough and attach them to the sides of the body.  Press on candy sprinkles for eyes.  Form a beak, a scarf, and a hat or earmuffs out of colored dough.  Press them in place.  Store in refrigerator.
